text: Imbali is a township in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. It is 15 km from Pietermaritzburg, the capital city of KwaZulu-Natal. Imbali was founded in the early 1960s when people were moving away from the rural areas to look for employment in the city. ==Notable Residents== * Bathabile Dlamini - Leader of the African National Congress Women's League (ANCWL).Previously the Minister of Women, Youth and Persons with Disabilities (South Africa), and Minister of Social Development (South Africa). * Luyanda Ntshangase - Footballer who played in the South African Premier Division for Maritzburg United. ==References== Category:Populated places in the Msunduzi Local Municipality Category:Townships in KwaZulu-Natal
title: Imbali
